column4: I just put in my IDE HDD now, and it's not showing up in Computer or Media.. what to do?
yah try sudo fdisk -l
it'll tell the available disks
if it isn'
sudo fdisk -l
you've plugged it via ata, so it's isn't plug in play, you have to mount it
yeah, i executed sudo fdisk -l and it gave me a list that contains only ONE HD.. got any more ideas?
hate to be a newbie, but how to mount?
if it's not there you probably wont be able to mount it
pastebin /var/log/messages
gosh..that disk contains my files before i migrated to ubuntu...
can you pastebin the output of /var/log/messages
again, newbie in over his head here...
cat dmesg > dmesg.txt
then pastebin the contents of dmesg.txt
here's the link.. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63913/
yes, i see you only have one disk.. can you try to pastebin cat dmesg > dmesg.txt
the output of that command is a textfile(dmesg.txt), pastebin the contents :)
quick question, did the bios recognize your drive?
got it there now, man. sorry.. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63915/ ...yep, the bios had it right..
weird, i don't see any attempt to recognize another drive, it's as if the drive isn't connected
can you reboot? make sure the bios recognizes your drive first :)
